executive_summary: Building Lighting Control System Manufacturers make components and develop software for building lighting control systems. Manufacturers derive their demand from a few different places. Downstream demand comes primarily from four markets, residential, commercial, industrial and institutional. Throughout the period, there has been a varying degree of demand from each market. During COVID-19, demand from all markets except residential clients was crushed. Following COVID-19, office buildings remained at a heightened vacancy rate as many companies continued remote work. On top of these harmful macroeconomic trends, import penetration remains the single largest threat to manufacturers during the period. The rapid appreciation of the US dollar has increased the presence of imports in the US economy, as US buyers purchase from foreign manufacturers since the US dollar is worth more in foreign economies. Due to numerous disruptions in downstream markets, industry-wide revenue has been falling at a CAGR of 4.2% to an expected $1.6 billion in 2023, when revenue is estimated to fall another 1.5%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 proved to be a strong roadblock for the industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Aside from a few bright spots in downstream demand, namely from residential clients, demand plummeted for the industry. As the dollar appreciated, exports came to a halt, dropping significantly in 2020 alone, rendering the industry's largest market effectively useless for the year. With mandates from the federal and state governments, any nonessential businesses had to cease production. Because of this, the industry lost demand from several crucial downstream markets. These include state and local institutions, colleges, commercial buildings and industrial clients.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising interest rates have restrained growth towards the end of the period
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In early 2022, the Federal Reserve announced that it would be increasing interest rates across the US economy to try and dial in the rampant, persistent inflation. Increasing interest rates have limited the expansion of industry operators as the cost of financing large projects becomes much more costly. This slowed down the rate at which companies needed new lighting systems. Increasing interest rates have affected downstream demand as exports, housing markets, and business activity are all sensitive to interest rate changes. The industry is set to experience falling demand across many downstream markets in 2023.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: INTERNATIONAL TRADE WILL CONTINUE TO BE CRUCIAL TO REVENUE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: After a period of decline, exports are anticipated to return to growth and play an important role in industry revenue during the outlook period. Exports will be supported by a depreciating dollar, making US domestic exports cheaper to foreign buyers. With an expected depreciation of the US dollar, manufacturers can be more confident in the global outlook moving forward in comparison to the prior period, where the industry endured sharp volatility in the trade-weighted index.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: AN EXPECTED RETURN OF BUSINESS ACTIVITY WILL BOLSTER THE DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Following a period of faltering business activity, demand for larger lighting control systems is set to grow. As global issues reduce and companies begin to return to in-person work, there will be a higher demand for the larger, more complex lighting systems featured in commercial buildings. This segment will also be supported by an expected jump in corporate profit. With more money on hand, a corporation will look to update or expand its offices.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: REGULATIONS AND PREFERENCES WILL WIDEN DEMAND FROM DOWNSTREAM MARKETS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: During the next five years, laws and regulations surrounding buildings are anticipated to change. The growing presence of energy efficiency standards and environmental regulations will drive demand for new and improved products that meet these new regulations.

industry_definition: Companies in the Building Lighting Control System Manufacturing industry manufacture components and develop software for building lighting control systems. These systems include components and software that control communication with switches, motion sensors and light sensors to provide flexible scheduling, daylight harvesting, occupancy control, personal control and load shedding.
key_trends: Interest rates continue to be a hindrance to growth, causing uncertainty both in this period and through 2028.
Major macroeconomic trends held growth back during the current period, with residential growth being one of the few bright spots for manufacturers.
Increased tariffs on specifically Chinese goods have benefitted manufacturers as import penetration is still the greatest threat to lighting system manufacturers.
A crumbling nonresidential market pulls revenue down with it
COVID-19 stemmed increased demand for targeted residential products
Infrared technology has been adapted to occupancy sensors
Companies in the Great Lakes benefit greatly from proximity to several factors
The West and Mid-Atlantic regions have a high concentration of both consumers and businesses
Signify bolstered its presence in the market during the period

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes manufacturing plants, assembly plants and warehouses. Due to major supply chain shortages across the world, many commodities and raw materials experienced heightened volatility.

Commercial customers include offices, restaurants and retail businesses. Commercial clients make up one of the largest downstream markets for manufacturers. In 2020, the outbreak of COVID-19 caused many companies to move operations online, so they were able to adhere to the restrictions. A lot of these moves ended up being permanent, leading to a structural decline in demand for manufacturers in this segment.

This segment included homes, apartment buildings and condos. As COVID-19 tore through the US, consumers had to remain home. As a result, many would look to upgrade their homes. Thus, increased investment in home improvements helped to offset any further declines in revenue during 2020.

Institutional customers include educational, political and medical institutions. This segment has faced ups and downs throughout the period. The fastest-growing market has been private higher education institutions. Due to their lower reliance on government funding, private secondary education institutions have sought to reduce electricity costs by optimizing lighting in classrooms and other facilities. While higher education experienced growth, local and state government investment stagnated as funds were focused elsewhere.

products_and_services.product_description: Remote mounted, wall-box and fixtures are all considered occupancy sensors and classified as so. These sensors are more targeted toward smaller rooms and outdoor spaces. Due to their nature, demand for the products comes from consumers or the residential market. Compared with the entire systems of controls featured in daylight dimming systems.

Also known as daylight harvesting controls, this system uses photo sensors to detect light levels and control the amount of lighting needed in a room or location accordingly. These dimming systems are more popular with businesses/ larger clients. Because of its association with businesses and larger clients, the segment faced falling growth in 2020. As many operations went online, there was no need to purchase new lighting systems.

tier_1_suppliers: Semiconductor & Circuit Manufacturing in the US
Circuit Board & Electronic Component Manufacturing in the US
Lighting & Bulb Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Electrical Equipment Manufacturing in the US
Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US
Electronic Part & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_buyers: Industrial Building Construction in the US
Commercial Building Construction in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Local and state governments provide much of the financing for municipal buildings, schools, government offices and other public service locations. Many of these buildings are required to meet certain environmental efficiency and energy conservation goals, which may in part be met by installing industry goods. Consequently, when local and state government expenditure rises, some of this spending may be allocated to upgrading government-owned buildings with industry products.

Consumer spending represents the amount that consumers spend on all goods and services in the United States. Since building lighting controls can be a discretionary expense, industry performance is contingent upon consumers' propensity to spend. When consumer spending rises, the industry is likely to benefit, as consumers allocate more spending to purchasing products and services.

The homeownership rate represents the proportion of households that own the home in which they live. Homeowners are more likely to invest in upgrading their lighting systems than renters, as lighting systems represent an investment into the value of a property. As more individuals own homes, the potential market for industry products expands, benefiting industry revenue.

The value of private nonresidential construction represents the amount of spending on buildings for commercial, industrial, educational or religious purposes. As investment in nonresidential structures increases, demand for building lighting control systems also rises.

international_trade_points.trade_title: HIGH IMPORT PENETRATION LINGERED THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD
international_trade_points.trade_description: Through 2023 most of the increase in imports is due to the appreciating US dollar throughout the period. An appreciating dollar makes domestically produced goods more expensive in relation to foreign products, so industry customers are more likely to purchase foreign goods.

Supply chain issues tipped the balance of the global markets in 2020 as COVID-19 raged on. This helped to diminish the rapid import growth that was taking place in the industry prior to COVID. Declining imports were short-lived. Imports skyrocketed after 2021 as the global markets recovered from the disruptions.

international_trade_points.trade_title: IMPORT PENETRATION AND AN APPRECIATING US DOLLAR DEPRESSED EXPORTS THROUGH THE PERIOD
international_trade_points.trade_description: Even as the US economy recovered in 2021, export growth didn't return to pre-pandemic levels. Any growth that exports saw during the recovery has been suppressed by an appreciation in the US dollar. An appreciating US dollar makes domestically produced goods more expensive to foreign buyers – meaning foreign buyers are less likely to purchase industry products from domestic manufacturers – weakening exports. This is exemplified in 2019, 2020, and 2022 as the appreciation of the US dollar was met with falling exports.

international_trade_points.trade_title: A FALTERING GLOBAL TRADE SCENE SQUASHED EXPORTS DURING COVID-19
international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports are a crucial piece to this industry. That's why any global phenomena that disrupt the markets also tend to disrupt the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The West accounts for the largest concentration of industry establishments, as this region is a hotbed for technological innovation since so many universities, hospitals and major companies are present. This region houses California, the largest concentration of establishments in the US. Manufacturers in California benefit from a massive downstream housing market, as well as some of the top tech-based universities in the country.
The Southeast region has the second-highest percentage of establishments at around 20%, which is slightly higher than its population percentage of around 18%.

The Mid-Atlantic region has the second largest concentration of establishments next to the West. The Mid-Atlantic houses a large portion of the population, making it an ideal location to supply downstream markets with several products, including thermostats for businesses and apartment and housing units. New York contains the region's highest concentration of establishments. Highly populated and offers opportunities for manufacturers, providing them with downstream demand from the residential and nonresidential sectors.

The Great Lakes offer two perfect traits for a region. The first is its proximity and access to Canada, the largest exporter of domestic goods. The second is the manufacturing hubs located in the Great Lakes region, giving manufacturers untapped access to large industries. Proximity to these hubs also removes the friction of shipping cross-country, boosting efficiency.

regulations_points.regulation_description: This standard specifies that indoor and outdoor lighting systems must automatically turn off when not in use. Additionally, control systems should be in place to enable light reduction, separate control of display lighting and independent control of daylight zones.

basis_points.basis_title: Signify bolstered its presence in the market during the period
basis_points.basis_description: This came mostly from their acquisition of player Cooper Lighting.

basis_points.basis_title: Rising interest rates at the end of the period have slowed acquisition activity
basis_points.basis_description: Rising interest rates at the end of the period have slowed acquisition activity, as debt is much more costly.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Signify more than doubles its market share during the period
concentration_points.concentration_description: With the acquisition of Cooper Lighting in 2020, Signify has cemented itself as the largest company operating in the industry.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Rising Interest Rates are Anticipated to Slow Concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: Rising Interest Rates are Anticipated to Slow Concentration

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Recent Volatility Has Kept Purchases High
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Touting the largest expense for the industry, purchases account for 45.1% in 2023. In order to manufacture products for this industry, there are high upfront costs in the form of fabricated metal products, circuit boards, semiconductors and other products associated with lighting control system manufacturing. Due to COVID-19 and related disruptions, manufacturers have faced heightened costs during the period.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Despite the high capital investment, operations require a high input of skilled labor, keeping wages high for manufacturers.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Despite the high capital investment, operations require a high input of skilled labor, keeping wages high for manufacturers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served my incumbent operators.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served my incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: FALTERING NONRESIDENTIAL ACTIVITY DEPRESSED THE REVENUE OF MANUFACTURERS
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand from downstream markets is affected primarily by construction activity. During the period, a falling value of private nonresidential construction shows diminished commercial market activity. Poor performance in the commercial market led to wavering demand for building light control system manufacturers.

volatility_points.volatility_title: STRONG HOUSING GROWTH HELPED OFFSET FURTHER DECLINES IN 2020
volatility_points.volatility_description: Another major downstream market is residential, which looks to install lighting control systems in homes. Because of the nature of COVID-19, consumers had to remain home, causing a massive investment in home ownership, and leading to increased investment in their homes. As a result, as more homes were being built or inhabited, more lighting systems had to be installed, lifting an otherwise falling industry.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Also known as daylight harvesting controls, this system uses photo sensors to detect light levels and control the amount of lighting needed in a room or location accordingly. These dimming systems are more popular with businesses/ larger clients. Because of its association with businesses and larger clients, the segment faced falling growth in 2020. As many operations went online, there was no need to purchase new lighting systems.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: REMOTE-MOUNTED, WALL-BOX AND FIXTURE-MOUNTED OCCUPANCY SENSORS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Remote mounted, wall-box and fixtures are all considered occupancy sensors and classified as so. These sensors are more targeted toward smaller rooms and outdoor spaces. Due to their nature, demand for the products comes from consumers or the residential market. Compared with the entire systems of controls featured in daylight dimming systems. Therefore, occupancy sector demand largely follows residential activity, which was bolstered in 2020 as consumers invested heavily in home improvements.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by imports?
FAQs.answer: Import penetration typically rises as the US dollar strengthens and foreign goods become more affordable for domestic consumers. Imported goods are often less expensive as it costs less to produce industry products in countries such as China and Mexico.

FAQs.question: How does your company market its products?
FAQs.answer: Operators often sell their products through sales representatives and directly to other companies.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers in this industry often use aluminum and cooper as inputs. Prices for these commodities tend to fluctuate substantially.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower-wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Outsourcing the manufacture to low-cost regions greatly reduces wage costs. Many industry operators outsource manufacturing to China and Mexico.

FAQs.question: How does your company leverage new technology, such as the internet and the Internet of Things (IoT)?
FAQs.answer: The rise in various internet and smartphone technologies has enabled operators to enhance their products. Moreover, specialized machinery has helped operators produce specialized controls that perform well in specific applications.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation has helped to limit wage expenses for most of our employees. This has helped to free up funds to invest in products and services in order to create a better customer experience.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations, such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Participation in industry assistance groups and seminars keeps us aware of industry news and changes. Additionally, investment in new manufacturing equipment helps to enhance efficiency and adhere to legislation.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Operators implement standard operating procedures that are followed on a daily basis. Additionally, operators conduct training sessions and offer courses to enhance workers' understanding of the processes and how they relate to their safety.

FAQs.question: How does your company maximize revenue?
FAQs.answer: Many companies in the industry produce a wide range of lighting products. Companies with a wide range of products benefit from the ability to cross-sell their products.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Due to product specialization, many customers renew their contracts. Operators' custom-made products have become integrated in clients' operations, and they subsequently depend on them for their reliability.
